question: Who is the current Australian Prime Minister?
clarification: As of 18th March. Knowing Australian politics, it might change some time later today.

answers.specificFollowUp: Incorrect. Julia Gillard was our first female Prime Minister, and was in power from 2010 until 2013.
Incorrect. Tony Abbott was our previous Prime Minister, and was in power from 2013 until 2015 when the ruling Liberal party voted to change leadership.

generalFollowUp: Malcolm Turnball became Prime Minister on September 14th 2015, not through a popular vote, but because the ruling Liberal party chose to have him replace Tony Abbott as leader. He was re-elected in a federal election in 2016.
